Work Duration: 8 months (An 8 month employment period is registered as 2 separate, consecutive work terms). Please ONLY apply if you are available for 8 months, and state your availability CLEARLY in your cover letter.

Note For Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. Engineering undergrads -- If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each extra work term above the mandatory four.

details.value:
Why work for Pani / What will you do here?

As a co-op student in the software development department, you will directly contribute to Pani's success by coding and releasing new features, fixes, and improvements to Pani's customer facing SaaS product and back-end processing systems. You will develop and use highly desirable technical skills including Python, REST APIs, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React, Amazon Web Services, Relational Databases, Time Series Data, Distributed Systems and Processing, and more.

You will be a core member of the software development team working directly with other team members and stakeholders in our software development life cycle; we don't do 'co-op projects' at Pani. You will end your workday feeling amazing in that your efforts are directly contributing Pani's environmental mission to globally reduce greenhouse gasses.

Desired Qualifications and Education

The successful candidate will be a strong communicator and problem solver that has previous web based development experience from prior work terms, school, or hobby projects. We are looking for a 3rd or 4th year software engineering, computer science, or equivalent student.
8 month minimum commitment (this is non negotiable)
Student on Vancouver Island or the lower mainland.
While this is a mostly remote position, successful candidate must be able to attend in person team building and strategy sessions roughly every couple of months in Victoria, BC.
Experience coding in Python.

Nice to have:

Experience developing REST APIs in Python via a framework like Flask, Django, or FastAPI
Experience with front end development and fundamentals (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Nice to have: mobile/tablet compatibility (Responsive design, touch interactions)
Experience with a modern JavaScript framework (preferably React)
Experience working with Git version control.
Nice-to-have is tangential experience with engineering/math (through join majors or electives, etc), as our product is engineering-heavy.

Softer Skills:

Driven to ask 'why' questions about work they are given
Strong verbal communicator comfortable working directly with stakeholders
Asks for clarification when they don't have full understanding
High general intelligence and problem solving abilities
